definition: to cultivate one's mind/to build character
to grasp/to hold/to operate/to manage/to control/to steer/to exercise/to drill (practice)/to play/to speak (a language)

sentences.english: She read the best authors in an attempt to cultivate her mind.
sentences.chinese: 她为陶冶情操而阅读最优秀作家的作品。
这是一本陶冶情操的书。

sentences.english: She reads classic novels in an attempt to cultivate her minds.
sentences.chinese: 她为了陶冶情操而阅读经典著作。

sentences.english: Reading can cultivate people's temperament, edify sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 阅读能培养人的性情，陶冶情操。

sentences.english: This software edify sentiment while giving your art enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 本软件陶冶情操的同时给您艺术的享受。

sentences.english: First of all, university education can help student cultivate sentiments.
sentences.chinese: 首先，大学教育可以帮助学生陶冶情操。

sentences.english: Art nurtures the soul and culture cultivates the mind.
sentences.chinese: 艺术滋润心灵，文化陶冶情操。

definition: lit. to fire pots and smelt metal/fig. to educate
to cultivate the heart and nurture the character (idiom); to improve oneself by meditation
to make learning fun/to combine education and entertainment
to like/to take pleasure in/keen on/fond of/interest/hobby/appetite for/CL:個|个[ge4]
